questionTitle: Which of the following is an open-source extension of the part of the UML system dealing with profiles?
questionExplanation: SysML stands for Systems Modeling Language.

questionOption1: The UML standard is the work of the Object Management Group
questionOption2: SysML creates graphical representations of software systems in the form of a set of diagram types
questionOption3: UML diagrams are separated into four structural types and seven behavior types
questionExplanation: UML diagrams are separated into seven structural types and four behavior types.

questionTitle: Which of the following combines a modeling language with a graphical display of the various SOA components?
questionExplanation: SOMF software allows developers to create an action plan to implement their business processes.

questionTitle: Which of the following element in SOMF determines how components are exposed?
questionExplanation: In SOMF, the modeling is based on the elements of the service life cycle.

questionOption1: Star model is favored in orchestration processes
questionOption2: UML models often use XMI as their interchange format
questionOption3: XMI files are generally interchangeable between the different modeling languages that can use them
questionExplanation: XMI has been codified as an international standard by ISO, as IS0/IEC 19503:2005.

questionTitle: Which of the following provides information on service and service boundaries, service granularity, and asset analysis?
questionExplanation: IBMâ€™s Service-Oriented Modeling and Architecture is well-known SOMF modeling technology.

questionTitle: How many types of modeling topologies for message passing are used in SOMF?
questionExplanation: Four modeling topologies for message passing are used in SOMF.

questionTitle: Which of the following topology has no orchestrator in the system?
questionExplanation: A circular topology is one where message passing is carried out in a circular fashion.

questionTitle: Which of the following topology is useful for services that use broadcasting or multicasting services?
questionExplanation: In a star topology, services are designed to connect through a central service.

questionTitle: Which of the following topology has a many-to-many relationship between services and their clients?
questionExplanation: The advantage of a network topology is that the overhead associated with message passing has been minimized.
